abstract: The Day: What are we to make of recent use of "chutzpah" by a couple of politicians who don't have a Jewish bone in their bodies? Also, what City Room is reading in other newspapers and blogs.
snippet: The Day: What are we to make of recent use of "chutzpah" by a couple of politicians who don't have a Jewish bone in their bodies? Also, what City Room is reading in other newspapers and blogs.
lead_paragraph: Here in New York, which probably has more Yiddish speakers than any other city in the world, including in Israel, what are we to make of recent uses of a certain Yiddish word by a couple of politicians who don't have a Jewish bone in their bodies? We're referring to the Mormon Mitt Romney and the evangelical Christian Michele Bachmann.

headline.main: Romney, Bachmann and the Oys of Yiddish
